0.name: The Prince - Raspberry Habanero
0.description: Maybe it's because of the smooth blend of sweet and heat that makes us think of Prince, maybe it's because we can't help singing Raspberry Beret everytime we eat it, either way, this sauce reigns supreme.
0.bestOn: Pork, chicken, burgers, merlot or another fruity red wine would go great as well.

1.name: Green With Envy - Jalapeno Lime
1.description: It won't leave you red faced and begging for water but this middle of the road sauce is great to bring some citrus tang and mellow kick to whatever you are chowing on.
1.bestOn: Eggs, beef, chips, margaritas, tongue (Tyler's recommendation, seriously it's good)

2.name: Smokey the Bear - Chipotle
2.description: Smokey doesn't like fires and that applies to his hot sauce too. Mild with enough smokiness to bring out the fire department
2.bestOn: Anything you want to add some smokiness to, pairs well with whiskey

3.name: Summer Daze - Watermelon Serrano
3.description: It's basically a bottled version of summer. This sauce brings the sweet brightness of watermelon and earthy heat of serrano peppers to the party. Middle of the scale on heat, this in one you can eat all day.
3.bestOn: Pork and beef are the big winners here

4.name: Island In The Sun - Pineapple Habanero
4.description: Like sitting on the beach too long, this sauce brings the burn. The pineapple adds some sweetness but doesn't take any of the edge off the habanero kick and lasting fire.
4.bestOn: Pork, chicken, tortilla chips, Belgian tripel style beers, IPAs, wheat beers

5.name: The Smokeshow - Arbol & Chipotle
5.description: Like the perfect blend of looks and personality, this sauce does it all. Blending smoke and peppery heat together gives a huge flavor boost and lasting heat to whatever you drop it on.
5.bestOn: Beef, pork, chicken, your hand, cabernet sauvignon, whiskey, veggies

6.name: Killer Bees - Honey Roasted Habanero
6.description: Sweet and heat is one of my favorite combos. The one two punch goes great with so many things and with autumn here, I think this will fit right in with the cold weather.
6.bestOn: This is a very thin sauce so best when mixed in with a dish, great on veggies, whiskey and anything you want a sweet/spicy combo on

7.name: Ti-Malice - Haitian Creole Blend
7.description: Ti-Malice comes from Haitian folklore and is named after it's creator, Ti-Malice the trickster. Ti-Malice got fed up having to share food with his nemesis, Bouki, so he created this sauce to cause so much pain to Bouki that he would stop eating. Unfortunately, Ti-Malice's plan backfired, and because the sauce ended up being so good it is now a staple of Carribean style hot sauces.
7.bestOn: Eggs!, toast, burritos, wheat beer (Blue Moon especially)

8.name: Cherry Bomb - Smoked Cherry Habanero
8.description: Just like the firecracker it is named after, an explosion of flavor followed by smokey goodness
8.bestOn: Vanilla bean ice cream, beef, bourbon, dark chocolate

1.bestOn: Beef, pork, chicken, your hand, cabernet sauvignon, whiskey, veggies

2.name: Plan B - Roasted Ghost Pepper
2.description: As Mike Tyson once said 'Everybody has a plan until they get punched in the mouth'. Mirroring both the spirit and intent of those words, this sauce hits hard so be prepared.
